KE.description: Cholera cases have been reported in several counties. Risk is higher in areas with limited access to clean water.
prevention: Drink only boiled or treated water
Wash hands with soap before eating and after using the toilet
Seek medical care immediately if you develop watery diarrhea and vomiting

KE.description: Malaria remains common in many regions, especially at night and near stagnant water.
prevention: Sleep under an insecticide-treated mosquito net
Use mosquito repellent on exposed skin
Drain standing water around your home
Seek testing if you develop fever, chills, or headaches

GLOBAL.description: Respiratory infections including COVID-19 continue to circulate globally.
prevention: Stay up to date with recommended vaccination
Cover coughs and sneezes, and wash hands regularly
Avoid close contact with people who are visibly sick

GLOBAL.description: Colds and flu circulate year-round with seasonal peaks.
prevention: Wash hands frequently with soap and water
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth
Seek medical advice if you have difficulty breathing or chest pain
